thread.title_full: Get soup Wednesday, and bring home the bowl

title: Get soup Wednesday, and bring home the bowl
text:
Get soup Wednesday, and bring home the bowl Empty Bowl Dinner at St. Stephen's Lutheran Church starts at 5 p.m. Post to Facebook Get soup Wednesday, and bring home the bowl Empty Bowl Dinner at St. Stephen's Lutheran Church starts at 5 p.m. Check out this story on delawareonline.com: http://delonline.us/1RUgO55 Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Join the Conversation Second Helpings Patricia Talorico , The News Journal 1:34 p.m. EDT October 20, 2015 
Soup bowls made by a Dover artist will be given away at a $20 soup meal served Wednesday at Wilmington's St. Stephen's Lutheran Church. (Photo: Submitted) 
St. Stephen's Lutheran Church is sponsoring an Empty Bowl Dinner on Wednesday, Oct. 21 to benefit Family Promise, an interfaith network that provides shelter and meals for homeless families, and funds the church's food ministries. 
Soup will be served at 5 and 6:30 p.m. at the church, 1301 N. Broom St. in Wilmington. The cost is $20. 
An Empty Bowl Dinner brings together restaurants, artists, bakeries, faith communities and neighbors to raise funds for those in need. 
Participants enjoy donated soup and bread and can pick out a bowl made by a local artist to take home. 
Sanford School donated 44 bowls. Florence Wiley of Wiley Woman Pottery in Dover donated 71 bowls. 
Contact Patricia Talorico at (302) 324-2861 or ptalorico@delawareonline.com and on Twitter @pattytalorico Read or Share this story: http://delonline.us/1RUgO55 Most Popular
